caption:
This photograph features an outdoor community garden set against a backdrop of dilapidated buildings and high-rises. In the foreground, three individuals are engaging with the garden in various ways. On the left, a young girl in a black tank top and shorts, with her hair pulled back, is walking along a dirt path while looking at something in her hands. In the center, another young girl, also in a black tank top and shorts, with short hair, is moving toward a flower bed. On the right, a man wearing a dark blue t-shirt and jeans is bending over, tending to the flowers; he appears to be picking or planting something.

The garden itself is lush and densely planted with a vibrant variety of flowers and vegetables. There are makeshift walkways and partitions, and some areas are covered with cloths, perhaps as makeshift greenhouses or to protect certain plants.

The immediate background shows a row of old buildings in various states of disrepair, with visible damage and exposed interiors. Beyond that, modern apartment buildings rise up, presenting a contrast between the neglected old structures and the more contemporary urban environment.

The scene is a blend of natural beauty and urban decay, suggesting a community effort to bring life and greenery into a rundown urban area. The garden brings a splash of color and vitality to an otherwise gray and deteriorating setting, highlighting themes of urban renewal and community interaction.
title: City "farmers" cultivate thriving garden.  Volunteers were assigned their plots by community association.  The square block formerly the site of a brewery, extends from 92nd to 93rd street and from 2nd to 3rd avenue
